Drive east on the Trans-Canada Highway (Highway 1) from Vancouver for about 100km until you get to the city center. You will see the "London Drugs" and "Cottonwood Mall" sign before Exit 119.

Chilliwack is one of Greyhound's major depots, and virtually every bus running past it East, West or North will stop there.

Chilliwack has an airport popular with recreational pilots, but no scheduled commercial flights.  Closest commercial airports are Abbotsford (YXX), Bellingham Washington (BLI), and Vancouver (YVR)

There are two main roads in Chilliwack, and they're actually just one road with two different names. From the highway at Exit 119, running South it's called Vedder Road all the way to Yarrow, and running North it's called Yale Road. 

Go North on Yale Road, you'll find old downtown, with a variety of restaurants, quaint shops, and some nice parks. 

Go South on Vedder Road, and you'll pass through the commercial centre of the city, but soon enough you'll be through the city and into the suburbs, where you can find Vedder Crossing, the Vedder River, Cultus Lake, Yarrow, and the Chilliwack Lake Provincial Park.
Chilliwack Transit covers the main parts of Chilliwack with barely used buses. Transit is centered on Cottonwood Mall.

content=A fun summer attraction for kids and adults, and a nice way to pass a very hot day. Twilight rates are available, and while it's not the sort of place you need to go often, it's a good a one-day outing from much of the Lower Mainland, especially with kids. Best bets are late June and early July, or rainy days, as it can often be very busy.

Hike! There are lots of nice trails in and around Chilliwack. A good place to start is the Chilliwack Lake Provincial Park (http://www.env.gov.bc.ca/bcparks/explore/parkpgs/chilliwack_lk/) where you can find several trails that are easy to get to by road and of varying lengths.
Fishing is popular on the Vedder River. Make sure you're in season and that if you need a license you obtain one. Licenses can usually be obtained at bait shops, and some other places too.
